body:
![build](https://github.com/cosmo-lang/cosmo/actions/workflows/crystal.yml/badge.svg) # Cosmo Cosmo is a statically-typed programming language written in pure Crystal.
We have an [extension for VS code](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=cosmo.vscode-cosmo) ([source](https://github.com/R-unic/vscode-cosmo)), however it currently only features syntax highlighting. ## Things I Gotta Do ### Features - Enums - Utility methods for tables - Stack trace - Multiline strings - Allow throwing class instances that inherit from a base `Exception` class - Interfaces - Namespaces - Classes * single inheritance * mixins * static/protected members - Better type system * type inference * generics * casting union types * implicit conversions * intersections ### Fixes - Performance boosts lol - Weird expression parsing (`[0].123` evaluates to 0.123??) - Segfaults * `TypeChecker.get_mapped` * e.x. `x << [1]` - Handle infinite recursion * macro function to set recursion depth limit ### Refactorings - File for each AST node ### Meta - Package manager ([WIP](https://github.com/cosmo-lang/stars)) - Documentation generator - Linting/language server ## Things I Might Do - Named arguments - Allow functions with no arguments to be called without parentheses - Make declarations immutable by default and replace `const` with `mut` - Make into a compiler or bytecode interpreter - C bindings ## Installation ### Linux/OSX 1. Install [Crystal](https://crystal-lang.org/install/). 2. Run `sudo make install`. 3. Assert everything is working by running `cosmo -h` ## Contributing 1. Fork it () 2. Create your feature branch (`git checkout -b my-new-feature`) 3. Commit your changes (`git commit -am 'Add some feature'`) 4. Test your code (`make test`) 5. Push to the branch (`make publish`) 6. Create a new Pull Request ## Contributors - [R-unic](https://github.com/R-unic) - creator and maintainer

def.name: get_elapsed
def.body:
span = finish - start
ms = span.total_milliseconds.round(5)
if ms > 1000
  return "#{(ms / 1000).round(2)} seconds"
end
"#{ms}ms"

instance_methods.name: read_file
instance_methods.doc: Reads a file at `path` and returns it's contents
instance_methods.summary: Reads a file at path and returns it's contents

def.name: read_file
def.body:
begin
  contents = File.read(path)
  read_source(contents, file_path: path)
rescue ex : Exception
  abort("Failed to read file \"#{path}\": \n#{ex.message}\n\t#{ex.backtrace.join("\n\t")}", 1)
end

instance_methods.name: run_repl
instance_methods.doc: Starts the REPL
instance_methods.summary: Starts the REPL

def.name: run_repl
def.body:
puts("Welcome to the #{rainbow("Cosmo")} REPL!")
loop do
  STDIN.write("Â» ".to_slice)
  line = STDIN.gets
  if line.nil? || line.chomp.empty?
    break
  end
  result = read_source(line, file_path: "repl")
  puts(result.is_a?(Hash) ? Stringify.hashmap(result.as(Hash(ValueType, ValueType))) : result.to_s)
end

def.name: new
def.body:

def.name: to_s
def.body:
s = "Literal<{\n"
@hashmap.keys.each do |k|
  s = s + (TAB * (indent + 1))
  s = s + (k.to_s(indent + 1))
  s = s + " -> "
  s = s + (@hashmap[k].to_s(indent + 1))
  s = s + "\n"
end
s + "#{TAB * indent}}>"

instance_methods.name: single_expression
instance_methods.doc:
It yields itself for any node, but if it's a
`Statement::ExpressionList`, then it returns the
first node of the `ExpressionList` statement
instance_methods.summary: It yields itself for any node, but if it's a Statement::ExpressionList, then it returns the first node of the ExpressionList statement

instance_methods.name: single_expression?
instance_methods.doc:
It yields `nil` always for any regular node.
(It is overridden by `ExpressionList` to implement `#single_expression`.)
instance_methods.summary: It yields nil always for any regular node.

instance_methods.name: single_expression?
instance_methods.doc: It yields first node if this holds only one node, or yields `nil`.
instance_methods.summary: It yields first node if this holds only one node, or yields nil.

def.name: single_expression?
def.body:
if @nodes.size == 1
  expr = @nodes.first.single_expression
  if expr.is_a?(Statement::SingleExpression)
    expr.expression
  else
    expr.as(Expression::Base)
  end
else
  nil
end

instance_methods.name: define_field
instance_methods.args_string: (field_name : String, value : ValueType, token : Token | Nil, constant : Bool = false, visibility : Visibility = Visibility::Public, typedef : Token | Nil = nil) : ValueType
instance_methods.args_html: (field_name : String, value : ValueType, token : Token | Nil, constant : Bool = false, visibility : Visibility = Visibility::Public, typedef : Token | Nil = nil) : ValueType

def.name: define_field
def.body:
current_meta = @field_meta[field_name]?
if current_meta.nil?
else
  if current_meta[:"constant?"] && (!@constructing)
    Logger.report_error("Attempt to assign to constant property", field_name, token.not_nil!)
  end
end
if @field_meta[field_name]?.nil?
  meta_hash = {} of Symbol => Token | Bool
  meta_hash[:"constant?"] = constant
  if typedef.nil?
    if current_meta.nil?
    else
      typedef = current_meta[:type]
      TypeChecker.assert(typedef.lexeme + "|void", value, typedef)
    end
  else
    meta_hash[:type] = typedef
  end
  @field_meta[field_name] = FieldMeta.from(meta_hash)
end
registry = visibility == Visibility::Public ? @public : (visibility == Visibility::Protected ? @protected : @private)
(registry["fields"].as(Hash(String, ValueType)))[field_name] = value
value

instance_methods.name: define_method
instance_methods.args_string: (method_name : String, value : Function, token : Token | Nil = nil, visibility : Visibility = Visibility::Public) : Function
instance_methods.args_html: (method_name : String, value : Function, token : Token | Nil = nil, visibility : Visibility = Visibility::Public) : Function

def.name: define_method
def.body:
registry = visibility == Visibility::Public ? @public : (visibility == Visibility::Protected ? @protected : @private)
if (!token.nil?) && (registry["methods"].has_key?(method_name))
  Logger.report_error("Duplicate method definition in '#{name}'", method_name, token)
end
registry["methods"][method_name] = value
value

instance_methods.name: get_field
instance_methods.args_string: (field_name : String, token : Token | Nil = nil, include_private : Bool = true, include_protected : Bool = false) : ValueType
instance_methods.args_html: (field_name : String, token : Token | Nil = nil, include_private : Bool = true, include_protected : Bool = false) : ValueType

def.name: get_field
def.body:
field = @public["fields"][field_name]?
if include_private
  field || (field = @private["fields"][field_name]?)
end
if include_protected
  field || (field = @protected["fields"][field_name]?)
end
if (token.nil? || include_private) || @private["fields"][field_name]?.nil?
else
  Logger.report_error("Attempt to access private field", field_name, token)
end
if (token.nil? || include_protected) || @protected["methods"][field_name]?.nil?
else
  Logger.report_error("Attempt to access protected field outside of class definition", field_name, token)
end
field.as(ValueType)

def.name: get_member
def.body: (get_method(member_name, token, include_private, include_protected)) || (get_field(member_name, token, include_private, include_protected))

instance_methods.args_string: (method_name : String, token : Token | Nil = nil, include_private : Bool = true, include_protected : Bool = false) : Function | Nil

def.name: get_method
def.body:
method = @public["methods"][method_name]?
if include_private
  method || (method = @private["methods"][method_name]?)
end
if include_protected
  method || (method = @protected["methods"][method_name]?)
end
if (token.nil? || include_private) || @private["methods"][method_name]?.nil?
else
  Logger.report_error("Attempt to access private method", method_name, token)
end
if (token.nil? || include_protected) || @protected["methods"][method_name]?.nil?
else
  Logger.report_error("Attempt to access protected method outside of class definition", method_name, token)
end
method.as(Function | ::Nil)

def.name: setup
def.body:
ctor_method = get_method("construct", include_private: false)
if ctor_method.nil?
else
  @constructing = true
  ctor_method.call(@args, return_type_override: "void")
  @constructing = false
end

constructors.args_string: (interpreter : Cosmo::Interpreter, closure : Cosmo::Scope, definition : Cosmo::AST::Node, class_instance : Nil | Cosmo::ClassInstance = nil)

_

instance_methods.name: call
instance_methods.args_string: (args : Array(ValueType), return_type_override : String | Nil = nil) : ValueType

def.name: call
def.body:
return_type_override || (return_type_override = return_typedef.lexeme)
enclosing_return_type = @interpreter.meta["block_return_type"]?
@interpreter.set_meta("block_return_type", return_type_override)
scope = Scope.new(@closure)
if @class_instance.nil?
else
  scope.declare(@interpreter.fake_typedef(@class_instance.not_nil!.name), @interpreter.fake_ident("$"), @class_instance)
end
params = @definition.is_a?(Statement::FunctionDef) ? (@definition.as(Statement::FunctionDef)).parameters : (@definition.as(Expression::Lambda)).parameters
params.each_with_index do |param, i|
  value = args[i]? || (param.default_value.nil? ? nil : @interpreter.evaluate(param.default_value.not_nil!))
  scope.declare(param.typedef, param.identifier, value.as(ValueType), const: param.const?)
end
result = nil
begin
  body = @definition.is_a?(Statement::FunctionDef) ? (@definition.as(Statement::FunctionDef)).body : (@definition.as(Expression::Lambda)).body
  result = @interpreter.execute_block(body, scope, is_fn: true)
rescue returner : HookedExceptions::Return
  if return_type_override == "void"
  else
    result = returner.value
  end
rescue ex : Exception
  raise(ex)
end
if enclosing_return_type.nil?
  @interpreter.delete_meta("block_return_type")
else
  @interpreter.set_meta("block_return_type", enclosing_return_type)
end
result

instance_methods.name: add_object_value
instance_methods.args_string: (token : Token, object : V, key : ValueType, value : ValueType) : V forall V
instance_methods.args_html: (token : Token, object : V, key : ValueType, value : ValueType) : V forall V

def.name: add_object_value
def.body:
if object.is_a?(Array)
  if key.is_a?(Int)
  else
    Logger.report_error("Invalid index type", TypeChecker.get_mapped(key.class), token)
  end
  if object[key]?.nil?
    object.insert(key, value)
  else
    object[key] = value
  end
else
  if object.is_a?(Hash)
    object[key] = value
  else
    if object.is_a?(ClassInstance)
      if key.is_a?(String)
      else
        Logger.report_error("Invalid index type", TypeChecker.get_mapped(key.class), token)
      end
      object.define_field(key, value, token)
    else
      Logger.report_error("Attempt to assign to index of", TypeChecker.get_mapped(object.class), token)
    end
  end
end
object

def.name: declare_intrinsic
def.body:
location = Location.new("intrinsic", 0, 0)
ident_token = fake_ident(ident, location)
typedef_token = fake_typedef(type, location)
@globals.declare(typedef_token, ident_token, value, const: true)

instance_methods.name: execute_block
instance_methods.args_string: (block : Statement::Base, block_scope : Scope, is_fn : Bool = false) : ValueType

def.name: execute_block
def.body:
enclosing = @scope
begin
  @scope = block_scope
  if @meta["this"]?.nil? || (!@scope.lookup?("$").nil?)
  else
    this = @meta["this"].as(ClassInstance)
    @scope.declare(fake_typedef(this.name), fake_ident("$"), this)
  end
  if block.is_a?(Statement::Block)
    if block.nodes.empty?
    else
      return_node = block.nodes.find do |node|
        node.is_a?(Statement::Return)
      end || block.nodes.last
      body_nodes = block.nodes[0..-2]
      body_nodes.each do |stmt|
        execute(stmt)
      end
      if return_node.nil?
      else
        return_value = execute(return_node)
      end
    end
    if is_fn
      return_type = @meta["block_return_type"]
      token = return_node.nil? ? Token.new("none", Syntax::None, nil, Location.new("", 0, 0)) : return_node.token
      if return_type.to_s == "void"
      else
        TypeChecker.assert(return_type.to_s, return_value, token)
      end
    end
  else
    return_value = execute(block)
  end
  if return_type.to_s == "void"
  else
    return return_value
  end
  nil
rescue ex : Exception
  raise(ex)
ensure
  @scope = enclosing
end

def.name: interpret
def.body:
@file_path = file_path
parser = Parser.new(source, @file_path, @run_benchmarks)
statements = parser.parse
statement_list_str = ""
statements.each do |stmt|
  statement_list_str = statement_list_str + (stmt.to_s + "\n")
end
if @output_ast
  puts(statement_list_str)
end
resolver = Resolver.new(self)
resolver.resolve(statements)
end_time = Time.monotonic
if @run_benchmarks
  puts("Resolver @#{@file_path} took #{get_elapsed(resolver.start_time, end_time)}.")
end
start_time = Time.monotonic
result = nil
statements.each do |stmt|
  result = execute(stmt)
end
main_fn = @globals.lookup?("main")
is_public = @globals.public?("main")
found_main = (!main_fn.nil?) && main_fn.is_a?(Function)
if found_main
  if is_public
    main_fn = main_fn.as(Function)
    return_typedef = main_fn.return_typedef
    if TypeChecker.is?(return_typedef.lexeme, 1, return_typedef)
    else
      Logger.report_error("Invalid main() function", "A main() function may only return 'int'", return_typedef)
    end
    main_result = main_fn.call([ARGV.map() do |__arg0|
      __arg0.as(ValueType)
    end])
    TypeChecker.assert("int", main_result, return_typedef)
  else
    puts("[WARNING]: Found main() function, but it is not public. It will not be called on program execution.")
  end
end
end_time = Time.monotonic
if @run_benchmarks
  puts("Interpreter @#{file_path} took #{get_elapsed(start_time, end_time)}.")
end
if (found_main && (@file_path != "test")) && (@file_path != "repl")
  code = main_result.not_nil!.as(Int64)
  if code == 0
    Process.exit(code)
  else
    raise("Process exited with code #{code}")
  end
end
result

def.name: visit_access_expr
def.body:
object = evaluate(expr.object)
key = expr.key.lexeme
if object.is_a?(Hash)
  value = object[key]?
  if value.nil?
    Logger.report_error("Invalid table key", "'#{key}'", expr.key)
  end
  value
else
  if object.is_a?(Array)
    (VectorIntrinsics.new(self, object)).get_method(expr.key)
  else
    if object.is_a?(String)
      (StringIntrinsics.new(self, object)).get_method(expr.key)
    else
      if object.is_a?(Number)
        (NumberIntrinsics.new(self, object)).get_method(expr.key)
      else
        if object.is_a?(ClassInstance)
          object.get_member(key, expr.key, include_private: !@meta["this"]?.nil?)
        else
          Logger.report_error("Attempt to index", TypeChecker.get_mapped(object.class), expr.token)
        end
      end
    end
  end
end

def.name: visit_binary_op_expr
def.body:
left = evaluate(expr.left)
right = evaluate(expr.right)
case expr.operator.type
when Syntax::Plus
  op = Operator::Plus.new(self)
  op.apply(expr)
when Syntax::Minus
  op = Operator::Minus.new(self)
  op.apply(expr)
when Syntax::Star
  op = Operator::Mul.new(self)
  op.apply(expr)
when Syntax::Slash
  op = Operator::Div.new(self)
  op.apply(expr)
when Syntax::SlashSlash
  op = Operator::IntDiv.new(self)
  op.apply(expr)
when Syntax::Carat
  op = Operator::Pow.new(self)
  op.apply(expr)
when Syntax::Percent
  op = Operator::Mod.new(self)
  op.apply(expr)
when Syntax::AmpersandColon
  left && right
when Syntax::PipeColon
  left || right
when Syntax::EqualEqual
  left == right
when Syntax::BangEqual
  left != right
when Syntax::Less
  op = Operator::LT.new(self)
  op.apply(expr)
when Syntax::LessEqual
  op = Operator::LTE.new(self)
  op.apply(expr)
when Syntax::Greater
  op = Operator::GT.new(self)
  op.apply(expr)
when Syntax::GreaterEqual
  op = Operator::GTE.new(self)
  op.apply(expr)
when Syntax::Tilde
  op = Operator::Bxor.new(self)
  op.apply(expr)
when Syntax::Pipe
  op = Operator::Bor.new(self)
  op.apply(expr)
when Syntax::Ampersand
  op = Operator::Band.new(self)
  op.apply(expr)
when Syntax::RDoubleArrow
  op = Operator::Bshr.new(self)
  op.apply(expr)
when Syntax::LDoubleArrow
  op = Operator::Bshl.new(self)
  op.apply(expr)
end

def.name: visit_case_stmt
def.body:
value = evaluate(stmt.value)
go_to_else = false
stmt.comparisons.each do |when_stmt|
  condition = true
  when_stmt.conditions.each do |condition_expr|
    if condition_expr.is_a?(Expression::TypeRef)
      condition = condition & (TypeChecker.is?(condition_expr.name.lexeme, value, when_stmt.token))
    else
      condition = condition & ((evaluate(condition_expr)) == value)
    end
  end
  if condition
    return execute(when_stmt.block)
  end
  go_to_else = true
end
if (!stmt.else.nil?) && go_to_else
  return execute(stmt.else.not_nil!)
end

instance_methods.name: visit_class_def_stmt
instance_methods.doc: abstract def visit_enum_def_stmt(stmt : EnumDef) : R
instance_methods.summary: abstract def visit_enum_def_stmt(stmt : EnumDef) : R

def.name: visit_class_def_stmt
def.body:
_class = Class.new(self, @scope, stmt)
if @scope.lookup?(stmt.identifier.lexeme).nil?
else
  Logger.report_error("Cannot redefine class", "Class #{stmt.identifier.lexeme} is already defined.", stmt.identifier)
end
@scope.declare(fake_typedef("class"), stmt.identifier, _class, const: true, visibility: stmt.visibility)

def.name: visit_compound_assignment_expr
def.body:
case expr.operator.type
when Syntax::PlusEqual
  op = Operator::PlusAssign.new(self)
  op.apply(expr)
when Syntax::MinusEqual
  op = Operator::MinusAssign.new(self)
  op.apply(expr)
when Syntax::StarEqual
  op = Operator::MulAssign.new(self)
  op.apply(expr)
when Syntax::SlashEqual
  op = Operator::DivAssign.new(self)
  op.apply(expr)
when Syntax::PercentEqual
  op = Operator::ModAssign.new(self)
  op.apply(expr)
when Syntax::CaratEqual
  op = Operator::PowAssign.new(self)
  op.apply(expr)
when Syntax::AmpersandColonEqual
  op = Operator::AndAssign.new(self)
  op.apply(expr)
when Syntax::PipeColonEqual
  op = Operator::OrAssign.new(self)
  op.apply(expr)
end

def.name: visit_every_stmt
def.body:
enclosing = @scope
@scope = Scope.new(@scope)
enumerable = evaluate(stmt.enumerable)
@scope.declare(stmt.var.typedef, stmt.var.token, nil)
@loop_level = @loop_level + 1
if enumerable.is_a?(Array) || enumerable.is_a?(Range)
  enumerable.each do |value|
    @scope.assign(stmt.var.token, value)
    begin
      execute_block(stmt.block, scope)
    rescue _break : HookedExceptions::Break
      if @loop_level == _break.loop_level
        break
      end
    rescue _next : HookedExceptions::Next
      if @loop_level == _next.loop_level
        next
      end
    end
  end
else
  if enumerable.is_a?(String)
    enumerable.chars.each do |value|
      @scope.assign(stmt.var.token, value)
      begin
        execute_block(stmt.block, scope)
      rescue _break : HookedExceptions::Break
        if @loop_level == _break.loop_level
          break
        end
      rescue _next : HookedExceptions::Next
        if @loop_level == _next.loop_level
          next
        end
      end
    end
  else
    if enumerable.is_a?(Callable)
      if enumerable.is_a?(IntrinsicFunction)
        Logger.report_error("Invalid iterator", "An iterator cannot be an intrinsic function", stmt.enumerable.token)
      end
      if enumerable.is_a?(Function)
      else
        Logger.report_error("Invalid iterator", "An iterator must return a generator function", stmt.enumerable.token)
      end
      while !(      value = enumerable.call([] of ValueType)).nil?
        @scope.assign(stmt.var.token, value)
        begin
          execute_block(stmt.block, scope)
        rescue _break : HookedExceptions::Break
          if @loop_level == _break.loop_level
            break
          end
        rescue _next : HookedExceptions::Next
          if @loop_level == _next.loop_level
            next
          end
        end
      end
    else
      Logger.report_error("Invalid iterator type", TypeChecker.get_mapped(enumerable.class), stmt.token)
    end
  end
end
@scope = enclosing

def.name: visit_fn_call_expr
def.body:
fn = evaluate(expr.callee)
if fn.is_a?(Function) || fn.is_a?(IntrinsicFunction)
else
  Logger.report_error("Attempt to call", fn.is_a?(ClassInstance) ? fn.name : TypeChecker.get_mapped(fn.class), expr.token)
end
if fn.arity.includes?(expr.arguments.size)
else
  arg_size = fn.arity.begin == fn.arity.end ? fn.arity.begin : fn.arity.to_s
  Logger.report_error("Expected #{arg_size} arguments, got", expr.arguments.size.to_s, expr.token)
end
arg_values = expr.arguments.map do |arg|
  evaluate(arg)
end
fn.call(arg_values)

def.name: visit_fn_def_stmt
def.body:
if @meta["this"]?.nil?
  @scope.declare(fake_typedef("func"), stmt.identifier, Function.new(self, @scope, stmt), const: true, visibility: stmt.visibility)
else
  instance = @meta["this"].as(ClassInstance)
  instance.define_method(stmt.identifier.lexeme, Function.new(self, @scope, stmt, instance), token: stmt.token, visibility: stmt.visibility)
end

def.name: visit_if_stmt
def.body:
condition = evaluate(stmt.condition)
if condition
  execute(stmt.then)
else
  if stmt.else.nil?
  else
    execute(stmt.else.not_nil!)
  end
end

def.name: visit_index_expr
def.body:
object = evaluate(expr.object)
key = evaluate(expr.key)
if object.is_a?(String) || object.is_a?(Array)
  if key.is_a?(Int) || key.is_a?(Range)
  else
    Logger.report_error("Invalid index type", TypeChecker.get_mapped(key.class), expr.key.token)
  end
  value = object[key]?
  if value.nil? && (!expr.nullable)
    Logger.report_error("Index out of bounds", "Index #{key}, array size #{object.size}", expr.key.token)
  end
  value
else
  if object.is_a?(Hash)
    value = object[key]?
    if value.nil?
      Logger.report_error("Invalid table key", "'#{key}'", expr.key.token)
    end
    value
  else
    if object.is_a?(ClassInstance)
      Logger.report_error("Attempt to index class instance", expr.token.lexeme, expr.token)
    else
      Logger.report_error("Attempt to index", TypeChecker.get_mapped(object.class), expr.token)
    end
  end
end

def.name: visit_multiple_assignment_expr
def.body:
values = [] of ValueType
expr.assignments.each do |assignment|
  if assignment.is_a?(Expression::VarAssignment)
    if assignment.value.is_a?(Expression::Base)
      values << (evaluate(assignment.value.as(Expression::Base)))
    else
      values << (assignment.value.as(ValueType))
    end
  else
    if assignment.is_a?(Expression::PropertyAssignment)
      if assignment.value.is_a?(Expression::Base)
        values << (evaluate(assignment.value.as(Expression::Base)))
      else
        values << (assignment.value.as(ValueType))
      end
    end
  end
end
resolved_assignments = expr.assignments.map_with_index do |assignment, i|
  if assignment.is_a?(Expression::VarAssignment)
    assignment.value = values[i]
  else
    if assignment.is_a?(Expression::PropertyAssignment)
      assignment.value = values[i]
    end
  end
  assignment
end
resultant_values : Array(ValueType) = resolved_assignments.map do |assignment|
  evaluate(assignment)
end
resultant_values

else

end
if expr.operand.is_a?(Expression::FunctionCall)
  args = (expr.operand.as(Expression::FunctionCall)).arguments

def.name: visit_property_assignment_expr
def.body:
if expr.object.is_a?(Expression::Index)
  index = expr.object.as(Expression::Index)
  object_node = index.object
  key = evaluate(index.key)
  object = evaluate(object_node)
else
  access = expr.object.as(Expression::Access)
  object_node = access.object
  key = access.key.lexeme
  object = evaluate(object_node)
end
value = expr.value.is_a?(Expression::Base) ? evaluate(expr.value.as(Expression::Base)) : expr.value.as(ValueType)
if object_node.is_a?(Expression::Index) || object_node.is_a?(Expression::Access)
  object = add_object_value(expr.token, object, key, value)
  prop_assignment = Expression::PropertyAssignment.new(object_node, object)
  return visit_property_assignment_expr(prop_assignment)
end
object = add_object_value(expr.token, object, key, value)
if (meta["this"]?.nil? || (expr.token.lexeme != "$")) || (!object.is_a?(ClassInstance))
  @scope.assign(expr.token, object)
else
  value
end

def.name: visit_unary_op_expr
def.body:
operand = evaluate(expr.operand)
case expr.operator.type
when Syntax::Plus
  if operand.is_a?(ClassInstance)
    return Operator.call_meta_method(operand, nil, "unp$", expr.operator.lexeme, expr.operator)
  end
  if operand.is_a?(Float) || operand.is_a?(Int)
    operand.abs
  else
    Logger.report_error("Invalid '+' operand type", operand.class.to_s, expr.operator)
  end
when Syntax::Minus
  if operand.is_a?(ClassInstance)
    return Operator.call_meta_method(operand, nil, "unm$", expr.operator.lexeme, expr.operator)
  end
  if operand.is_a?(Float) || operand.is_a?(Int)
    -operand
  else
    Logger.report_error("Invalid '-' operand type", operand.class.to_s, expr.operator)
  end
when Syntax::PlusPlus
  op = Operator::PlusAssign.new(self)
  op.apply(expr, "++")
when Syntax::MinusMinus
  op = Operator::MinusAssign.new(self)
  op.apply(expr, "--")
when Syntax::Bang
  !operand
when Syntax::Tilde
  op = Operator::Bnot.new(self)
  op.apply(expr)
when Syntax::Star
  if operand.is_a?(ClassInstance)
    return Operator.call_meta_method(operand, nil, "splat$", expr.operator.lexeme, expr.operator)
  end
  raise("'*' unary operator has not yet implemented.")
when Syntax::Hashtag
  if operand.is_a?(ClassInstance)
    return Operator.call_meta_method(operand, nil, "size$", expr.operator.lexeme, expr.operator)
  end
  if ((operand.is_a?(Array) || operand.is_a?(Hash)) || operand.is_a?(String)) || operand.is_a?(Range)
  else
    Logger.report_error("Invalid '#' operand type", TypeChecker.get_mapped(operand.class), expr.operator)
  end
  operand.size
end

def.name: visit_until_stmt
def.body:
@loop_level = @loop_level + 1
while !(evaluate(stmt.condition))
  begin
    execute(stmt.block)
  rescue _break : HookedExceptions::Break
    if @loop_level == _break.loop_level
      break
    end
  rescue _next : HookedExceptions::Next
    if @loop_level == _next.loop_level
      next
    end
  end
end

def.name: visit_use_stmt
def.body:
relative_module_path = stmt.module_path.lexeme
if relative_module_path.includes?("/")
  if @file_path == "repl"
    Logger.report_error("Cannot import", "Non-package modules are not supported in the REPL", stmt.module_path)
  end
  full_module_path = File.join(File.dirname(@file_path), relative_module_path)
  ext_file_path = File.exists?(full_module_path + ".cos") ? full_module_path + ".cos" : full_module_path + ".â­"
  if full_module_path.includes?("././")
    Logger.report_error("Recursive import detected", ext_file_path.gsub("./", ""), stmt.module_path)
  end
  module_path = ext_file_path.gsub("./", "")
  if File.exists?(ext_file_path)
  else
    Logger.report_error("Invalid import", "No such file '#{module_path}.cos/â­' exists", stmt.module_path)
  end
  import_file(ext_file_path)
else
  if @importable_intrinsics.has_key?(relative_module_path)
    @importable_intrinsics[relative_module_path].inject
  else
    file_path = File.join(File.dirname("/home/runic/Dev/crystal/cosmo/src/cosmo/runtime/interpreter.cr"), "../../../libraries", relative_module_path)
    full_path = File.exists?(file_path + ".cos") ? file_path + ".cos" : file_path + ".â­"
    if File.exists?(full_path)
      import_file(full_path)
    else
      Logger.report_error("Invalid import", "No package management system implemented yet. If you are trying to import a file path, prepend './' to the path.", stmt.module_path)
    end
  end
end

def.name: visit_var_declaration_expr
def.body:
in_global = @meta["this"]?.nil?

else

  instance.define_field(expr.var.token.lexeme, value, expr.token, visibility: expr.visibility, constant: expr.constant?, typedef: expr.typedef)
end

start_time = Time.monotonic
statements = [] of Statement::Base
while !finished?
  stmt = parse_statement
  statements << stmt
end
end_time = Time.monotonic
if @run_benchmarks
  puts("Parser @#{@file_path} took #{get_elapsed(start_time, end_time)}.")
end
statements

def.name: call
def.body:
mapped = args.map do |arg|
  if arg.nil?
    "none"
  else
    if arg.is_a?(Hash)
      Stringify.hashmap(arg.as(Hash(ValueType, ValueType)))
    else
      arg.to_s
    end
  end
end
puts(mapped.join('\t'))

def.name: resolve
def.body:
if statements.is_a?(Array)
  statements.each do |stmt|
    resolve(stmt)
  end
else
  statements.accept(self)
end

def.name: visit_case_stmt
def.body:
resolve(stmt.value)
stmt.comparisons.each do |comparison|
  comparison.conditions.each do |condition_expr|
    resolve(condition_expr)
  end
  resolve(comparison.block)
end
if stmt.else.nil?
else
  resolve(stmt.else.not_nil!)
end

instance_methods.name: assert
instance_methods.args_string: (typedef : String, value : ValueType, token : Token) : Nil

def.name: assert
def.body:
matches = is?(typedef, value, token)
if typedef.ends_with?("[]")
  value_type = typedef[0..-3]
  if value.is_a?(Array)
  else
    report_mismatch(typedef, value, token)
  end
  (value.as(Array)).each do |v|
    assert(value_type, v, token)
  end
else
  if (typedef.includes?("->")) && ((typedef.split("->", 2)).size == 2)
    types = typedef.split("->", 2)
    key_type = types.first.strip
    value_type = types.last.strip
    if value.is_a?(Hash)
    else
      report_mismatch(typedef, value, token)
    end
    internal = hash_as_value_type(value)
    internal.each do |k, v|
      assert(key_type, k, token)
      assert(value_type, v, token)
    end
  else
    if typedef.starts_with?("(")
      ungrouped_type = typedef[1..-2]
      assert(ungrouped_type, value, token)
    else
      if matches
      else
        report_mismatch(typedef, value, token)
      end
    end
  end
end

def.body:
casted = cast?(value, type)
if casted.nil?
  got_type = value.is_a?(ClassInstance) ? value.name : get_mapped(value.class)
  Logger.report_error("Failed to cast", "'#{got_type}' to '#{type.lexeme}'", type)
end
casted

def.name: cast?
def.body:
if is?(type.lexeme, "", type)
  value.to_s
else
  if (type.lexeme.includes?("char")) && (value.to_s.size == 1)
    value.to_s.chars.first
  else
    if (is?(type.lexeme, 1, type)) && (((value.is_a?(String) || value.is_a?(Float)) || value.is_a?(Int)) || value.is_a?(Bool))
      if value.is_a?(Bool)
        value ? 1 : 0
      else
        value.to_i
      end
    else
      if (is?(type.lexeme, 1.0, type)) && (((value.is_a?(String) || value.is_a?(Float)) || value.is_a?(Int)) || value.is_a?(Bool))
        if value.is_a?(Bool)
          value ? 1.0 : 0.0
        else
          value.to_f
        end
      else
        if (is?(type.lexeme, true, type)) && (value.is_a?(Float) || value.is_a?(Int))
          if (value.to_i == 1) || (value.to_i == 0)
            value.to_i == 1
          end
        end
      end
    end
  end
end

def.name: get_registered_type?
def.body:
if typedef.ends_with?("[]")
  value_type = typedef[0..-3]
  if get_registered_type?(value_type, token).nil?
  else
    Type.new(typedef)
  end
else
  if (typedef.includes?("->")) && ((typedef.split("->", 2)).size == 2)
    types = typedef.split("->", 2)
    key_type = types.first
    value_type = types.last
    if get_registered_type?(key_type, token).nil? && get_registered_type?(value_type, token).nil?
    else
      Type.new(typedef)
    end
  else
    if typedef.includes?("|")
      types = typedef.split("|")
      resolved = true
      types.each do |t|
        if get_registered_type?(t, token).nil?
          resolved = false
          break
        end
      end
      if resolved
        Type.new(typedef)
      end
    else
      REGISTERED.find do |t|
        t.name == typedef
      end
    end
  end
end

instance_methods.name: is?
instance_methods.args_string: (typedef : String, value : ValueType, token : Token) : Bool

def.name: is?
def.body:
case typedef
when "Range"
  value.is_a?(Range)
when "class"
  value.is_a?(Class)
when "type"
  value.is_a?(Type)
when "func"
  value.is_a?(Function) || value.is_a?(IntrinsicFunction)
when "bigint"
  value.is_a?(Int)
when "uint"
  value.is_a?(Int) && value > 0
when "int"
  value.is_a?(Int64 | Int32 | Int16 | Int8)
when "float"
  value.is_a?(Float)
when "bool"
  value.is_a?(Bool)
when "string"
  value.is_a?(String)
when "char"
  value.is_a?(Char)
when "none", "void"
  value == nil
when "any"
  true
else
  matches = false
  if typedef.starts_with?("(")
    ungrouped_type = typedef[1..-2]
    matches = is?(ungrouped_type, value, token)
  else
    if typedef.ends_with?("[]")
      value_type = typedef[0..-3]
      matches = value.is_a?(Array)
      if value.is_a?(Array)
        (value.as(Array)).each do |v|
          matches && (matches = is?(value_type, v, token))
        end
      end
    else
      if typedef.includes?("|")
        types = typedef.split("|")
        types.each do |type|
          if is?(type.strip, value, token)
            matches = true
          end
        end
      else
        if (typedef.includes?("->")) && ((typedef.split("->", 2)).size == 2)
          types = typedef.split("->", 2)
          key_type = types.first.strip
          value_type = types.last.strip
          matches = value.is_a?(Hash)
          if value.is_a?(Hash)
            (value.as(Hash)).each do |k, v|
              matches && (matches = is?(key_type, k, token))
              matches && (matches = is?(value_type, v, token))
            end
          end
        else
          if typedef.ends_with?("?")
            non_nullable_type = typedef[0..-2]
            matches = is?(non_nullable_type + "|void", value, token)
          else
            if matches
            else
              registered = get_registered_type?(typedef, token)
              if registered.nil?
              else
                if ALIASES.has_key?(registered.name)
                  unaliased = ALIASES[registered.name]
                  matches = is?(unaliased, value, token)
                else
                  if value.is_a?(ClassInstance)
                    matches = value.name == registered.name
                  else
                    Logger.report_error("Expected type #{registered.name}, got", get_mapped(value.class), token)
                  end
                end
              end
            end
          end
        end
      end
    end
  end
  matches
end

def.body:
case name.lexeme
when "join"
  Join.new(@interpreter, @cache, name)
when "push"
  Push.new(@interpreter, @cache, name)
when "pop"
  Pop.new(@interpreter, @cache, name)
when "shift"
  Shift.new(@interpreter, @cache, name)
when "first"
  First.new(@interpreter, @cache, name)
when "last"
  Last.new(@interpreter, @cache, name)
when "first?"
  FirstNullable.new(@interpreter, @cache, name)
when "last?"
  LastNullable.new(@interpreter, @cache, name)
when "sum"
  Sum.new(@interpreter, @cache, name)
when "filter"
  Filter.new(@interpreter, @cache, name)
when "map"
  Map.new(@interpreter, @cache, name)
else
  Logger.report_error("Invalid vector method", name.lexeme, name)
end

def.name: hashmap
def.body:
@@indent = base_indent
s = String::Builder.new("{")
push_indent(s)
hash.each_with_index do |entry, i|
  if i == 0
    s.write(("\n" + (TAB * @@indent)).to_slice)
  end
  key, value = entry
  if key.is_a?(String)
    s.write('"'.to_s.to_slice)
  end
  s.write(key.to_s.to_slice)
  if key.is_a?(String)
    s.write('"'.to_s.to_slice)
  end
  s.write(" -> ".to_slice)
  if value.is_a?(Hash)
    s.write((Stringify.hashmap(value, @@indent)).to_slice)
  else
    if value.is_a?(String)
      s.write('"'.to_s.to_slice)
    end
    s.write((value.nil? ? "none" : value.to_s).to_slice)
    if value.is_a?(String)
      s.write('"'.to_s.to_slice)
    end
  end
  if i == (hash.size - 1)
  else
    s.write(",".to_slice)
  end
  s.write("\n".to_slice)
  if i == (hash.size - 1)
  else
    s.write((TAB * @@indent).to_slice)
  end
end
pop_indent
s.write("#{TAB * @@indent}}".to_slice)
s.to_s
